# Whats New Docs

## Obsolete APIs

- [Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/whats-new/whats-obsolete.md): See how the .NET Framework class library marks members as obsolete. Understand the ObsoleteAttribute attribute, how to handle obsolete types and members, and more.
- [Obsolete types](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/whats-new/obsolete-types.md): See the list of types that are obsolete in .NET Framework 4.5 and .NET Framework 4.6, organized by assembly. Recommended alternatives are also listed.
- [Obsolete members](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/whats-new/obsolete-members.md): See the list of type members that are obsolete in .NET Framework 4.5 and later versions. Members are grouped by assembly.

## What's new and obsolete

- [What's new](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/whats-new/index.md): See what's new in various versions of .NET Framework. Read a summary of key new features and improvements in each version.
- [What's new in accessibility](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/main/docs/framework/whats-new/whats-new-in-accessibility.md): See what's new in .NET accessibility, starting with .NET Framework 4.7.1. Accessibility features let an app provide the right experience for Assistive Technology users.
